list.song: Why Do Lovers Break Each Others Hearts
list.artist: Bob B. Soxx & the Blue Jeans
list.description: i listened to this song a lot, it’s both sad and silly. an old head classic and i’ve probably heard it at marshalls (or smtn), but this year really felt like the first time.
i mean so clean, so brut, so melodic, and so melancholic. i have no idea what the lyrics even mean.
this sh** is mad fun, like, how does this 8 year old have drake energy?
there were so many singles this year, i really had to pick two songs.
i played this song like three times in a row while in the subway.
big simp energy, lol.
i am an unapologetic millennial? so when i heard this track i was like “fuck, this is like animal collective” but also 2020 pop, oh my.
i hate that this is a leak. but the whole apple bootleg mix kept me wishing there was at least one roy blair song out this year.
tbh i’ve never heard anyone in america conjugate words like that, everything this girl says feels so unhinged, maybe nordic humor or something?
so magical. pop records are forever. enough with it.
for obvious fu***ng reasons.
so laid back and moody…
i heard this song on blonded radio, perhaps last year, ended up listening to the same show a few weeks ago while picking up a friend from work, and was totally hooked for the good.
this song is so good, it just lands.
from that atlanta episode. i watched the whole series for the first time when work slowed down and the us election was two weeks away, so it felt relevant.
i try to pay attention to everything chassol does because it usually sounds new, including this video where three french kids play a clapping game.
a friend from madrid shared this song on ig; i didn’t really love it. a week later my little cousin played in my moms car and for some reason the second time it managed to seep in.

i feel that most non-spanish speakers (for obvious reasons) slept on this song, and in the spanish speaking world too, perhaps because it is not a dance hit. it talks about all the right things to think of in late march, distant love and the early stages of isolation, it’s a very precise song that appeared in a precise time.

list.song: It Isnt So Bad To Be Alone
list.description: it isn’t.

list.song: It's Just Like All The Clouds
list.description: manically soothing
good cold empty beach town music! Listened to the whole fleet foxes album the same day while looking for crabs on the shore, so they are connected forever!
it really does sound like teen siblings having fun w this family thing. Also very good story behind about being secret disco star.
this is so completely anodyne, good wallpaper breakfast or spreadsheet music nobody near will be bothered by. music for being boring to. useful
I think it is cowardly that covers of this remove the annoying muppet element. Re roisin murphy, who I first heard this song from, I’m glad that a lot of milf disco came out this year
nightly candy music
a zone
I love hearing about her. Definitely this EP is making December more fun

list.song: Ruby Don’t Take Your Love to Town
list.description: I knew as a novelty before, but as a nasty cooped up story this one got me this year. Mostly cause its singable.
similar to above, a sad clown song
I didn’t think Lucinda Williams could be cute? and yet. big fan
wish the future had sounded like this
how dreamy. like if u could simmer expressions into a silky broth
did get to dance with friends about this. excited to do more.

list.song: The Sun Falls Into The Sea
list.description: this album generally has been good for walking around the city bleakly
corn is nourishing
I was really charmed hearing of Carly Rae going to Disneyland and getting a Mickey to sign a contract so they'd clear the interpolation here. of a popeye song i guess? I am a mark

t's super old news but my last concert was seeing her in early March at Heaven. The dress code was gay elf or oversize sweatshirt and everyone seemed really happy to be there, truly the politest crowd, I wish them the best

she only gets better it seems. sort of like when your friend is trying to tell you they’re having a hard time, but wants it to be funny as a downplaying tactic (or/also because they love playing around, are in forever playing around mode)
this song made my mom laugh so much

This song is clearly Part 2 of the other Beyoncé song about her father, “Daddy Lessons”, the one that talks about how self-sufficient he (“that bastard”, the inherent epithet) once urged her to be. I wonder who is returning to whom? Beyoncé inhabiting the voice of the Father is her in Sage Mode, the mode of Benevolent Patriarch who dispenses advice wrangled from the hands of cruel experience. She, too, can assume that specific authority.
Something evergreen about a well-crafted song whose chorus is just the repetition of a name.

Here is the best version of the best song Shinee-member and reigning prince-twink Taemin has, to date, released. Here’s a K-pop song I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to Bok Bok or something. I’d recommend this song to a Berlin-based DJ with any interest in pop music. A lot of credit is due to SUMIN, the producer of this remix, whose breathy vocals really complete the outro. I also love her new buzzcut. Butch Korean Rights!

By the correct but also hilarious metrics of modern cancellation, if anyone were supposed to be cancelled by now, it would be Joji. But he seems to be avoiding the inevitable, and in the meantime we can listen to his album, NECTAR, which is a really great accomplishment. My Twitter acquaintance Braudie Blais-Billie called this track “very cute”. I heartily agree. Good job, Joji. Really good job. Extremely cute.

Ugh, songstress! The praise you could heap on this track is extremely obvious. The kaomoji Srta. Uchis pinned to the end of the title seems to have glitched on Spotify, because it just looks like a cat (?) whose face has passed through a mirroring software. Srta. Uchis sets out a plate of dressed fruit and we all just have to eat it. Plot twist: this song is actually about how we’re all strays and Srta. Uchis feeds us scraps.

One mood that always works for me is “pagan shepherdess keening on the mountainside”. I mean, the track is called “Tendril”; how much more clearly could it indicate exactly what type of song it is. I love the singing, which resembles both a liturgical enunciation and the act of gulping. In a moment of whimsical stew-brain, I tried imagining that ambulance tones were all replaced by the high vocals that recur in the second half of this song. Not a bad world, that imagining.

The song I actually wanted to include here is “The Tyrant Sheds His Armor” as interpreted by the same pipa musician, Lin Shicheng. At the moment, you can only listen to that song as the audio from a low-fi YouTube tape… Tragedy. I’m sad that Master Lin is dead, because I really wish I could listen to a good-quality studio version of his “Tyrant”. There’s one recording, but the song is abridged and weirdly not the same. I became obsessed with Lin Shicheng’s pipa interpretations for the same reason I became obsessed with Vlado Perlemuter’s piano Chopin. Both players are so reserved, so tight-fisted, so stingy with their emotions… It turns this music, which lends itself to gag-inducing sentimentally, into really good stuff. You’re allowed to re-see the conceptual in the staid and historical.

You’re listening to this track and walking down a country road in deep, rural Wisconsin. The road is paved but has no shoulder. You ask your friend: “Would it be possible to shoot a turkey with a handgun? What would that be called? Avicide?” Your friend replies: “With like, a Glock? You’re talking about walking out here and shooting a bird with a pistol? I feel like that would be called murder.”

In addition to feeling mauled by this song, I am obligated to include it because I listened to it over 130 times this year. This means that I’ve listened to this song for over seven hours, which honestly seems like too short an estimation. I remember a period early in quarantine when I would lay in bed and listen to this song over and over from my phone’s built-in speaker. This song is most familiar to me when it’s being muffled by the swell of a pillow.

The most cathartic moment on this track is the blaring, flattened beat which connects the first and second half. Good job, Oscar Görres. Thank you for this melancholy dog food for us mongrel homosexuals, Troye Sivan. Beautiful, high-wire synth melody at the end is also very “I stumble through the night-bound city under the glare of yellow lights; I am extremely gay and both happy and sad about it.”
Bad Bunny, long may he reign. Bad Bunny, long may he reign. Ten, ten, ten-one-thousand years…

list.artist: Christine and the Queens + Caroline Polachek
list.description: Whenever I hear an A.G. Cook remix, I just want to laugh. It’s an extremely pure, extremely joyous laughter. The laughter of a child! A ridiculous word that comes to mind is “untrammeled”! I laugh! I cackle! That melodic xylophone trill is just too funny!

What a chill-evoking, skin-beprickling, gag-inducing song. I want to dance to this song in a frigid venue at three in the morning. I want the DJ to bass-boost the entire thing, and I want to feel the song rip through my body. Baby Boy, baby boy… That’s me, isn’t it? I want to feel like I’m about to throw up because I’m so exhausted and this song, which is so good, is triggering an adrenal response that brings me close to fainting. Have I communicated how much I miss the club? I’m telling you, I used to live in the single hope of hearing a song like this, 130% speed, at a venue in Chicago. If you read the above and then listen to this song for the first time, you might think I’m overstating how visceral it is. Maybe I am, but the track sends me there… To the dance floor... The feeling of thrashing… Ugh… Ugh!

I’m gonna shimmy onto a limb, no paid advertisement, no reason or incentive, and call this song Perfect. I heard it the first time and really thought those exact words: this song is perfect. Here’s the song I was waiting for Yaeji to make, and she really pulled it off. Somehow, the second half of the track brings to mind the immense satisfaction of watching a group of children dribble basketballs in unison.

Critics didn’t like the extremely short seventeen-minute project that this track is taken from because they felt that both Kenny Beats and Denzel Curry phoned it in. OK guys, I mutter… Is it so bad to be this competent?

This is obviously Porter Robinson’s goal, but the Anamanaguchi remix of “Get Your Wish” makes me feel like I’m listening to the best quality, genuinely good version of an anime OST. It so precisely conjures the frenetic, whiplash energy that characterizes that kind of music.

It’s cool to be gifted this track from two DJs who work at the exact same temperature. The credits are nearly reversible, and it’s funny. This could easily be the Caribou remix of a Floating Points song.
I also want to make myself the woman that nobody wants to mistreat! Detransition, detransition… I’m dancing back in the opposite direction, everyone! Just kidding, just kidding! I’m kidding, OK?

The extremely specific image I associate with this song: booting awake in your pod-rig by injecting stimulants directly into a Keurig-esque slot implanted in your C2 vertebra. Waking up in a version of the future where housing ordinances have all shifted toward the Japanese. Not in that they’re cute or good; in that all the old housing stock has been demolished. Everyone now lives in warren-like new construction made up of tiny singles instead of, say, five people crammed into three bedrooms.

We return to the delicious abode of Srta. Uchis, where a vinyl recording of this track plays, muffled, in the middle distance. “What did I ask you? What didn’t I give you?” La Lupe wails. What a relatable question! Love a song that recalls the eviscerations we conduct in the name of love. Yell the answer! Yell it louder! How exactly were you disemboweled!? Good, now tell me three more times!

My top played songs of 2020 are all on the Folklore album and invisible string is my favorite. The album feels like a fog to hear all at once, but a series of lovely and familiar-feeling vignettes emerge with each re-listen.
Beabadoobee references 90s alt-rock but sounds effortlessly new and cool. Love her voice.
I think this would be a very good song for floating in a hot spring with the girl you have a crush on, à la the hot spring scene from The Half of It (2020).
Gia Margaret’s album creates an ambience for when you want to float all by yourself.
A startlingly tender song. Adrianne Lenker’s lyrics sound like they come from an intense but far away memory.
Even without the music video, this song conjures sunny images of HAIM strolling through Los Angeles with their skin bare and hair down.

The very tense election season inspired this cover of “Under Pressure” originally sung by David Bowie and Queen. This is a soothing but delightfully unexpected rendition for moments when you need to hold on to your patience.
Fiona Apple’s mind is so wide. In “Heavy Balloon”, she sings about fighting depression with imagery of spreading vines resplendent with “strawberries,” “peas and beans,” !
Beautifully controlled voice, stunning song.
Simple, catchy, and romantic. I love this song.
Rina Sawayama looks back with nostalgia on the friendships that fell through. Bittersweet, reflective, but still upbeat, all the feelings are there.
This one is so warm.
‘Comeback’ tells a lovely story of being on the precipice of finding your confidence again, and having a good time.
A lullaby that will have you dreaming of meadows.
A song about leaving a painful situation without making it worse. The wordless singing at the end of this song suggests a determination to move forward with lightness.
Sigrid mostly writes big, poppy, dance-able songs but when she releases a slow ballad I am addicted exclusively to that song for weeks.
A song that feels like an ache and a balm at the same time.
Naya Rivera passed away in July 2020. Her performance of ‘Mine’ is a reminder of the beauty we have lost.
Youtube persistently recommended that I listen to covers of this song in 2020, even though it came out in 2014. They are all lovely and this song is lovely.

Superbass is definitely not of 2020, but a decade after its release I sought it out for the first time in its entirety. It is the happiest song on my 2020 playlist and a necessary escape from daily gloom.

list.song: In Too Deep (feat. Kiana Ledé) - Acoustic
If You're Too Shy (Let Me Know)

list.description: The lyrics!!! A most gentle and soft song.
The whole band does a modern take on 판소리 (Pansori - traditional Korean musical storytelling) and they just do it so well. Really can't get over them, and their music videos are a must.

The lyrics basically mean I become a Wonder woman when I love you....it sounds better I promise. (My favorite part of this song is the lyric is 천재 소녀 (Genius Girl) - there's something about the way she sings it)
Similar to Nan chun to me but moodier. Also features Hyukoh.
Call me basic but yes Lala Land. Muttered this under my mask on a cvs run, and still a classic when I'm out of songs to listen.
Definitely had a billie phase in 2020...listened to a few on repeat but bad guy is the one that makes it.
Was on a NPR tiny desk phase during wfh, and HER is HER.
Karaokes need to have more Jorja Smith
My boss posted a Chika npr tiny desk link on Slack and very much listened to her while making some ads.
Tyler the Creator sounds very hot in this song
The music video!!!
Crazy little song which someone screams in the middle
I developed a Henry Lau phase right after quarantine. I don't listen to him as much anymore but this song was on repeat too often to not be on the 2020 playlist.

list.song: (Honestly a lot of late 2000s K-pop) but Sherlock
list.description: Late 2000s was a grand time of k-pop, and honestly SHINee was at its prime. Although I was never a SHINee World (샤월), a tribute.
A (recent) 2020 discovery - lovely christmas song.
"이 미친 세상에 어디에 있더라도 행복해야 해" ("Please be happy, wherever you are in this crazy world")

list.song: 밤이 깊었네 Oh! What a Shiny Night
list.description: Watch Hospital Playlist on netflix (I think US netflix has it too..?)
What's a 2020 playlist with no Dua:)
This song feels like a full-body cleanse... a much-needed release.
Justin Bieber sings about love, gratitude, and the cyclical nature of life.
The synth drop :(
I’m usually a night shower person, but for a good chunk of time this year, I took morning showers so that I could be jolted awake by this song.

list.song: If You're Too Shy (Let Me Know)
list.description: Pop perfection imo.
I love what Planet 1999 are doing with dream-pop. This song is a PARTY.
Jockstrap are such an exciting band. They seem so unafraid in their music-making.
This song is so euphoric. Amazing music video too!

list.song: Scared to Live (Live on Saturday Night Live)
list.description: I was floored when I first heard this song on SNL. He sounds so good live... also I looove ballads.

list.song: Nana (Like a Star Made for Me)
list.description: This was released in 2019, but I had to include it because I played this EP to death this year. Malibu is really on another level... she also has an incredible radio show on NTS called United in Flames. I highly recommend!

I read in an interview that Bladee was recently struck by lightning, survived, and is now running on pure angel energy. It really shows through in his recent work. This song sounds like transcendence :)
I love her mind.

list.song: I'll Be Here in the Morning
list.description: Townes Van Zandt really carried me through the first half of the year. There's something so comforting and grounding about his music.
I love how this song captures the youthfulness of her early work but sounds more evolved somehow. "Curious time... mystical time... wondrous time..." yup.
"I’ll hold your joy, I’ll hold your pain." Thank you, Ana Roxanne.
This song sounds like a warm memory.
I love the bouncy synth melody on this track... she really nailed the "dancing fawn on frozen land" sound.
She has the voice of an angel... it breaks my heart...
“I carved the words I said all over the tree trunks”
Charli's album rollout was so uplifting to follow during the most difficult weeks of lockdown. This song is the perfect closer... hope and uncertainty!

list.song: Now I Don't Hate California After All
God Sent Me Here To Rock You
The Dreamer Is Everyone in Her Dream

list.description: Probably my favorite track from I May Destroy You, which is also my favorite show this year. The lyric stings in a satisfying way.
As my not-so-subtle rebellion against my then boss, I played Zelda theme as loud as I could through the office speaker, really setting the mood for the pre-quarantine days.
I think this one is from Westworld S3, as bad as this season is, it provided me with some solid tunes on repeat especially during spring.

This is actually my most played song of 2020, to my surprise (lol). It’s not too surprising considering that I started playing it in mid March when I convinced my boss to start WFH, I probably left this song on repeat for work time cuz it’s quite enough to not wake up my then roommates, who are notoriously late risers.
Also from I May Destroy You. I remember playing this song on repeat during my flight (exodus) to Shanghai, which was arguably the most excruciating 24hr for me, physically.
Classic work soundtrack carried over from last year.
Also supported me through my flight back home, keeping my heartbeat on track.

I started listening to more jazz and soul in the second half of this year, it’s a good feeling knowing that I can leave the playlist on for as long as I want, and I wouldn’t need to switch or skip any song in hours.
Rest in peace Maestro
Thank you Jo Jo Rabbit for reminding me of this song.
Not my teenage mood coming back to haunt me.
I honestly don’t remember how I came about this song, but I’m glad it stayed.
I really keep listening to this song for those 10 seconds of “Hey Hey Hey” and “Oh Oh Oh”, but the repetition speaks to me dearly.
I always get pumped after listening to this song, and break out into some unfathomable dance immediately.

list.song: I Wish I Knew How It Would Feel to Be Free
list.description: Every year I got hooked on one Nina Simone song, last year was Stars.
Similarly, every year I got hooked on one Marvin Gaye song, last year was Sexual Healing, this year I have two.
The self-reflectiveness is extra ironic this year.
I didn’t listen to this song a lot this year but I remember distinctly I had a week of only Faye Wong’s songs
Instant masterpiece

Is it a coincidence that I broke out in some of the worst acne I’ve ever had after listening to this song on repeat?
I think not.

This song feels so perfectly of this year and when I found it I was immediately in love. Here we are, hopefully avoiding many of the things that used to bring us joy (We are not dancing in packed rooms, not making out with strangers, not taking public transit and airplanes, not splitting meals with friends inside restaurants, etc.). Instead, we are forced to embrace uncertainty, to be slapped around by Mother Nature, who to be honest, we haven’t been treating so well. If anyone would like to read my essays on public health & climate futuring all you have to do is ask!

2020 made me love FKA Twigs and for that I am grateful. I mostly listen to this one when there is a lot of cloud cover, or when I am in the shower, or sometimes as I walk around the neighborhood just sort of glowering and shuffling uphill.
Just so clearly a mood I would be in. Perfect for doing the dishes. Perfect for swaying alone with lights dimmed. Perfect for being stuck.
I’m just like Oh Tommy take me away

This song reminds me of driving to Abu Dhabi with my friends Noora and Farah, probably because I nabbed this song off of one of their playlists. It’s from this moment when I felt so overjoyed, so excited to face the year! I guess this song kind of feels to me like the wild places we went—abandoned malls, the most decadent hospital I’ve ever seen, a camel farm, to the Louvre.

How could I not include this song? One time I FaceTimed Kevin and we went too hard to this song and literally did nothing else (primarily due to internet issues but also because it felt right). A fond 2020 memory. My house was shaking.

M to the b m to the b m to the m to the m to the b m to the b m to the b m to the m to the m to the b
~ Just me things ~

I was not a Fiona Apple fan, except maybe weirdly the song Werewolf from her 2012 album. And then suddenly mid-to-late-2020 came and I fell deeply and swiftly into a Fiona Apple hole. Fetch the Bolt Cutters is really somehow perfect right now. However, to be honest, I still found myself actually mostly just listening to Criminal on repeat.
I would simply be lying if I didn’t admit to listening to this over and over again. And I am also in love with my future and can’t wait to see you there.

Okay yes, the first time I heard this song was during the Twilight baseball scene. But then I never heard it again. And despite my long-lasting love for St. Vincent I somehow didn’t realize it was by her? Been listening to it on repeat and envisioning the beautiful moment in which I get my 2 COVID-19 inoculations.

I know you’re probably like… Raina? Lorde? In 2020? But you know what? I had never heard this song before maybe this September? It’s perfect for everything I do: typing fast, strolling the neighborhood, taking gloomy showers, dancing alone with my reflection, etc.
Good for grooving in the backyard, helpful for writing an essay quickly.
I’m incredibly greedy and I also really do have it all. Incredible friends, wonderful family, time and energy, a real optimism for the future. Kisses ya’ll
Love is everywhere. Drink it in, sway a little, I love you.
This song sparkles.
Yes, please, take me away from this dimension.
For feeling completely dazed, spacing out, or spacing in, whatever.

s the fact I use this song consistently to study the reason I am constantly so horny? IDK w/e.

Anyway… If you’ve ever been curious what I listen to get me in the mood to just randomly apply to grad school, it’s this. I listen to this song on repeat and I get things I never expected to do done.

The guy that made this song is kind of an icon. I listened to and danced to this song a lot and really did feel lonely this 2020. I know I don’t have to tell you this, but I even danced with one of my dress mannequins in my bedroom to this song.

Also highlight: my grad school bff listens to this song too and that feels like a good surprise that ensures this song gets its place on the list.
If you didn’t like my 20 2020 song choices, I don't give a f–f–f– Ahh!

list.song: For The Night (ft. Lil Baby and DaBaby)
...And To Those I Love, Thanks For Sticking Around

list.description: the lover she mentions does not exist but you resonate with it anyways since somehow are your ex lovers are villains
I just feel her anger tbh and it’s valid.
I love metaphors that have to do with food.

list.song: WHY DO FUCKBOIS HANGOUT ON THE NET
list.description: the whole time I’m just like... tru. And then I want to dance and feel like a college student again
You know when winter is coming and the sky still shines lightly through the clouds that paint the sky? You’re a little sad but somehow feel slightly blessed?
I always want to cry when I listen to this song, but I can see myself slowly getting stronger every time I play it again.
Love songs are supposed to be about a person and another person... right? When I hear this I ask myself if I’m happy with the amount of love I give me.
Susie I want to warn you!!!!!!! You deserve more.
I just can’t imagine having the level of artistry of Tierra Whack and how she’s only 25. This song is like ok but I’m young and just human plz don’t judge me.
BTS and Halsey collaborating was a necessary moment. Plz watch the music video. You can’t like BTS and not appreciate their choreography.
Just a good song for a sad day when you want to work slow. You’re just a young person, you’re still learning.
This song will bring you soft tears of joy. This song is a friend who has got your back. It doesn’t rush you, it takes it’s time.
Ethereal, harp, perfection.
This is what plays in your mind when things just can’t get better. Will be a 2021 summer bop.
Sevdaliza’s voice and the instrumentals in this song produced pure magic from a time we never existed.
The chaotic we needed to end 2020. Also the first holiday song that didn’t give me seasonal depression.
Takes me back to when I could dance and with all my friends on a Saturday night. Now I just bounce my toes and butt cheeks to it while sitting on my couch. I too miss the heat from peoples bodies.
There’s only 5 whole lines in this song, but its mixed so fucking well..... like rly rly rly well. So well it’s not repetitive and sounds new the whole way through.

The badass fuckery in this song that is so directly from the night life that is currently non-existent. Shygirl forever brings out the party person within you. The little bit of glam and ego that exists deep inside you...she demands you free it that night.
I think I actually cried when I saw them perform this song in the shitshow that is Ladyland. I have the sharpied set list from somewhere.... make me find it and frame it <3
Wanting to destroy yourself but not really.

Julien Baker could lead an army with this song. I remember biking home and listening to this song on repeat. In a new city, not really sure what I'm doing there, my hands gripping the handlebars stinging from the cold. Very indie girl moment. Biking along the river past several sculpture gardens and boat houses. The river looked like the sea that day (big). The bridges reflecting off the water. Clumps of dead leaves swirling on the surface.

This song is the sun being too bright even filtered through the trees you feel the warmth of it on your back but its still too cold. But the sun is still a comfort. Another song listened on repeat a lot. Standing in a field of rushes not knowing if you’re allowed to be there. Running down a hill. Means a lot to a lot of other people too.

(Skip to 2:55)

Being 14, sleeping in, having a crush, watching anime, playing piano, being 15, drawing still lives, torrenting movies, watching NBC sitcoms, going to convenience stores, jaywalking across busy streets, being 16, being an SAT tutor, getting Korean food, having a crush, spiking coke bottles with rum, throwing up, taking the train, running around a mountain, hanging out on the track after school, eating lunch outside, having a crush, talking too loud in the library, kissing a girl because you think you should even though you don't like her, taking a mushy banana out of your backpack, eating lots of rice, fighting with your little sister, bantering with your history teacher, talking to your crush in the lunch line, making proclamations without knowing anything, thinking that you know everything, realizing you know nothing, graduating high school, moving away, talking to your crush one last time, saying goodbye.
I swear to god, a whole generation of us have been brainwashed into finding that weird mis-allocation of syllables across beats that dirty projectors does so incredibly satisfying.
Wanna touch the ones I love :(
Is it love or is it focus?
Dancing in starlight

list.song: Girls Just Want To Have Fun
list.description: Sun glints off ice floes breaking apart and drifting toward the horizon.

list.song: Last Thing He Said to Me in Person
list.description: This song is so bratty it borders on perverse. Reminds me of browsing soft-core porn on tumblr.
CL truly deserves so much more. She really could have had a successful transition to the U.S market if it weren’t for scooter braun probably.
Throwback to March vibes when everyone was down and freaking out but everyone in my house rallied around the bad bunny album.

When I first heard this song I thought it was from animal crossing. My last semester at college, when I thought my capstone was going to be about pop music, I made  everyone at the capstone proposal meeting listen to this song, which was, in hindsight, extremely cringe. At the time I thought it was genius.

list.song: NEVER MET! (100 gecs r3mix) [feat. Glitch Gum]
list.description: The one tiktok song that I actually choose to listen to. I, too, feel like Laura les like all the time.

list.song: Goku Vibes (feat. Tohji, Elle Teresa, Uneducated Kid & Futuristic Swaver)
list.description: The vibrato is crazy! It really sent me down this huge asian emo rapper rabbit hole.

There’s a moment toward then end, when she says “Como una gata” and she pauses after gat- letting all of the potential energy of the last vowel build up before expelling it. that moment gets me every time. I remember listening to this song while running early in the morning this summer in Portland. There’s something naive and childish about that delivery at the end that really made me want to stomp my feet on the pavement. As I ran past my old elementary school I couldn’t help but remember how I used to be really good at four square and wall ball. Anyways, degenerate girl regenerate to- regenerated girl degenerate to generate heat in the light  / love in the face of fear / fear in the face of God

All I can say is... like with almost all the other songs on the list, i love vocal processing, i love compression, i love pop music, i love harsh noise, i love cool girls, i love hot girls. This is a song that feels really scary and apprehensive.

This shit make my mind melt. I’ve only ever experienced real ASMR once in my life when my friend whispered in my ear, and his voice somehow sounded exactly like it went through a compression filter. I don’t know, maybe they hit the exact right frequency my eardrums are attuned to. This song, which is basically just an extremely pitched up and compressed remix of robbery by juice wrld,  does a really good job of approximating that feeling. As one comment puts it, “OH GOD OH FUCK IM GONNA CUM”

list.song: Anymore ft. Kim Petras [Laura Les Remix]
list.description: Lots of things to love with this one. the singsong introduction / audio tag of ~”Kim Petras and lil Aaron “ at the beginning  (as if u didn’t already know who u were about to listen to). straight up just calling your haters stupid. that classic hyper pop vocal processing of shaving the first and last couple of microseconds of every word (?) Not sure if that's how they do it exactly but, I love imagining each word completely blocky and separate, sitting like beads on a string. And lastly, the absolutely charming / wonky/ sincere breakdown at the end, like you took the sound of teenage angels warbling and compressed it to hell.

Being sad, being lonely, being wanted, wanting more, drinking fast, drinking slowly, dimming the lights, asking your friend to bring the strobe lights, hooking up the speakers, shaking floorboard, hey you wanna sit outside? Breathing in secondhand smoke, checking your phone for no reason, pushing your sweaty hair back, taking off a couple of layers, reading old texts, taking flash photos, -
